Deficiency Narrative: There was expired food observed in the refrigerator.

Correction Narrative: During the inspection the beds didn't water prood bedding on one bed.

Correction Narrative: During the inspeciton Cottage B refrigerator and freeze were dirty and had a broken shelf.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was found that there was no medication log were compeleted for the current month and some dates were missing on other medication logs.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection, it was found that there was no medication log were compeleted for the current month and some dates were missing on other medication logs.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was found that there was no medication log for a prescribed medication.
During the inspection two beds were observed without mattress covers.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection two beds had bed coverings on them.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, one refrigerator and one freezer were observed to be dirty with food spills. In one home, one pan was observed in the oven to have grease from the previous day.
A screwdriver was found on the floor in one of the a child's room.
During the walk-thru of a cottage there was expired over the counter medication, 2 bottles of pain reliever found in the medication cabinet.
During walk thru of the cottage bug spray and sunscreen was found unsecured. There was bug spray found unsecured in the common area located outside.
While reviewing child records it was found that a child missed the last scheduled dental appointment.
Correction Narrative: RCCR Inspector Annie Bagnato received an email from Rise Konarik from email address rkonarik@brownsonhome.org on 09/20/21. The child's dental appointment is scheduled for 9/23/21 at 8:50am. The operation plan for ensuring that appointment are made or promptly rescheduled is as follows: Staff will attempt to refrain from scheduling any appointment during final exams. Each cottage has a health, safety and emergency coordinator.  That staff will be the person responsible for ensuring that skipped/canceled appointments are promptly rescheduled or brought to the attention of the office.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that a child was pushed to the ground by a staff causing an open wound to the child's knee.
Correction Narrative: An email was received on this date stating that the staff involved was terminated on this date.

Deficiency Narrative: An email was received on 10/20/20 with the plan for compliance. It notes that the operation took the following actions: Toy clutter has been cleaned. Clothes on the floor have been put up. Trash on the floor has been thrown away.  Dirty toothbrush has been thrown away. Tents have been removed from the bedrooms and there is more walking space. An on site follow up inspection was done on 10/27/20.   One child's bedroom continues to have trash on the desk and on the  floor and remains cluttered.
Correction Narrative: An email was received on 11/06/20 with the plan for compliance. It notes that the operation took the following actions: Trash on the floor has been thrown away. Clothes on the floor have been put up. Operation staff have made reminder signs to help the children to pick up their rooms before leaving. Operation staff are conducting several rooms inspections per week to ensure cleanliness. An onsite follow up inspection was done on 11/24/20 and verified these corrections.

Deficiency Narrative: In Cottage A, a freezer had liquids that had spilled  and froze within the freezer. There was also three containers that contained unknown contents in the freezer with no known knowledge of expiration.
In Cottage A, there was a Lysol toilet bowl cleaner inside the children's bathroom shelf.
In Cottage A and Cottage B, there were dressers missing handles.  In Cottage B, there was a bunk bed that had exposed screws, missing plank on top bunk and missing the ladder.
Correction Narrative: An email was received on 10/20/20 with the plan for compliance. It notes that the operation took the following actions: All dressers with missing handles had handles replaced. Bunkbed with exposed screws, broken plank and missing ladder has been permanently removed from the cottage and replaced with a regular twin size bed.  A designated house parent in each cottage will inspect furniture for safety on a weekly basis. This was verified with an on site inspection on 10/27/20.

Deficiency Narrative: In Cottage A, there was a mupirocin ointment in a child's book shelf.

In Cottage A and Cottage B, there were several rooms that were cluttered with toys, clothes and trash on the floor.  In Cottage A, there was a toothbrush covered in black residue located in the bathroom shelf.
